title: Alex Bregman shares his advice for younger Red Sox teammates down the stretch
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Alex Bregman advises Red Sox teammates to focus on execution and simplicity as the playoff race intensifies.
Red Sox hold American League’s second wildcard spot with a 81-68 record, needing strong final games for a playoff berth.
Red Sox face a rough patch, going 4-6 in last 10 games, on verge of series sweep by Yankees.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s 1-1 draw vs. Toronto FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Revolution salvaged a 1-1 draw against Toronto FC with Luca Langoni’s 90th-minute equalizer at Gillette Stadium.
The team's playoff hopes hang by a thread despite not being officially eliminated due to Chicago's loss.
18-year-old Allan Oyirwoth impressed in his first MLS start, showing potential in a central midfield role.

title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Alex Cora wants the Red Sox to focus on current games, not future playoff prospects.
The Red Sox hold the second wild card spot in the AL, trailing the Yankees by 1.5 games.
Despite recent challenges, ESPN and FanGraphs give the Red Sox over 90% probability to make the postseason.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow, Red Sox chief baseball officer, is prioritizing hiring a general manager for the upcoming offseason.
The Red Sox haven't had a general manager since Breslow's appointment in 2024; the role's influence has diminished recently.
Five assistant GMs, including Raquel Ferreira and Eddie Romero, are potential candidates for the general manager position.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade wide receiver Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints for a 2027 sixth-round draft pick.
Polk had 12 receptions for 87 yards after being drafted 37th overall in the 2024 NFL Draft.
The trade leaves only two players from the Patriots' 2024 draft class on the team roster.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots aim to end a five-game losing streak to Dolphins in Miami ahead of Week 2 matchup.
Tyreek Hill's performance has dipped since 2023, with no catches over 30 yards since 2024's opener.
Tua Tagovailoa boasts a 7-0 career record against the Patriots, exhibiting efficient passing performances.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed a Southern Gothic-themed show at Boston's Roadrunner on September 12, 2025.
Cain's setlist included songs from her albums 'Preacher's Daughter' and 'Willoughby Tucker, I'll Always Love You'.
The show featured atmospheric stage design and a surprise collaboration with Jae Matthews of Boy Harsher.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars as Mike Flynt in 'The Senior', a film depicting a 59-year-old's return to college football.
Chiklis, an Andover High football alum, faced physical challenges filming tackle football scenes after decades away from the field.
The movie's screening and Q&A with Chiklis is scheduled for September 14 at AMC Boston Common before its national release.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Nine Massachusetts residents are included in Forbes' 2025 list of the 400 richest Americans.
Abigail Johnson is the wealthiest in Massachusetts with $35 billion, ranking 27th nationally.
Notable Massachusetts residents on the list include Robert Kraft, Robert Hale Jr., and Amos Hostetter Jr.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox suffer a 4-1 loss to the Yankees in the series opener at Fenway Park.
Boston managed only two hits, with several missed scoring opportunities, going 0-for-8 with runners in scoring position.
The Red Sox committed three errors, contributing to a lack of execution against their long-standing rival.
